intro: Cissampelos pareira var. senensis, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces distinctive, fleshy, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its vines can grow quite long, making it suitable for trellises or as a ground cover in shaded areas. The botanical features of this species make it both ornamental and ecologically significant in its native habitat.
